name: Art Deco Hotel Montana Luzern

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can't beat the breakfast buffet at the Montana. It has to be the best in all of Switzerland. The smoked salmon paired with cucumbers and feta was marvelous. Combined with the beautiful view of Lake Luzern from the dining room, we couldn't have asked for a better morning. The hotel is in a quiet location on the lake, so you don't get much street noise at night. You just take the funicular down to the road and have a very nice walk along the lakeside promenade. The bed in our room was comfortable, the bathroom clean and modern, the staff friendly . I give this hotel my stamp of approval. Mr. Biddle aka Thingorjus
reviews.title: What a great breakfast buffet!!

reviews.text: We loved the Hotel Montana. The location was great and the views of the lake and city were beautiful. The art deco rooms were large, super clean and very comfortable. The bars and lounges were very comfortable and fun to spend time in as well. Breakfast on the terrace was a great way to start the day.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is a little piece of paradise. The welcoming staff start the whole process of relaxtion off, continued by the beautiful rooms and the most fabulous view over Lucern and the lake that you can imagine. Rooms are beautifully appointed though we found a little warm on an August night. Strongly recommended,
reviews.title: Heaven in Lucern

reviews.text: When you are in Luzern, make also a trip to Rigi (mountain) and visit the Verkehrsmuseum.
reviews.title: A very nice hotel with comfortable rooms at a high standard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Close enough to the city centre to make the nice walk along the shore; but far enough for the immediate locale to be quiet.
reviews.title: worth that bit extra

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: spacious room, well furnished even if there are few towels in the bathroom , no toothbrush, no bathrobe, no slippers.
reviews.title: wondeful view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful atmosphere and wonderful lake view.
reviews.title: A Delightful Interlude with my Beautiful Wife

reviews.text: We celebrated our 25th anniversary at Montana this July, having experienced the hotel four years earlier and vowing to return. We were not disappointed - the staff was exceptionally cordial and friendly, the room with sweeping views of the lake/mountain/Luzern, the bar and terrace restaurant romantic and the food worth the cost. We enjoyed walking from the hotel into the city streets, sightseeing and browsing and stopping for wine/beer along the way.The only thing we'd change is how long we stayed - wish we could have added a few more days.
reviews.title: A superb hotel

reviews.text: We have enjoyed the hotel in the past but on this occasion there was one uncomfortable incident when providing a breakfast table for 6 seemed to be a problem.
reviews.title: beautiful location, nice room, nice view.....lots of construction noise right now and a bit pricey

reviews.text: nice hotel, great check in service, beautiful view....lot's of noise right now due to construction next door. No air conditioning. Good breakfast included.
reviews.title: Spectacular view, interesting design and a friendly atmosphere

reviews.text: We have been staying at the Montana Art deco hotel for just one night, traveling back to Belgium from Italy. As always (it was the third time) we were made very comfortable. The service is impeccable, the rooms are beautiful and the bar is very nice.
reviews.title: perfect service

reviews.text: We also had an excellent diner at the restaurant.
reviews.title: Unique hotel up the hill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will most certainly be staying at the Montana again
reviews.title: Very nice hotel but no aircion, great position, pricey food, smoking a problem in the bar.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We paid CHF15 per day for the car park. They have an elevator that takes you down the lake and within 10 to 15 minutes walk you will reach the old town. The breakfast is great but finishes a bit too early at 10:30 AM.
reviews.title: Possibly my favourite place on earth. And a fantastic staff.

reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay which was for a special occasion. It is a very well positioned hotel with excellent access via its own railway up the cliff which affords great views but out of the busy areas. Staff very helpful and polite. Was expensive especially for food. Smoking in the bar was very unpleasant and smokers did not confine themselves to special smoking tables with extraction. For the price it really should have aircon,.
reviews.title: very nice hotel

reviews.text: This is the kind of hotel (or town) you never want to leave! Located at an elevation to the city affording fabulous views of Lake Lucerne and the mountains beyond. There's a private funicular sort of thing to take you to the lake level. Rooms are of a reasonable size with a small balcony facing the lake, the bathrooms in the standard rooms are shower-only and a little small, but perfectly adequate. Free wifi and breakfast make the hotel better value than the price tag (around 300 CHF for a double room) would suggest.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel with the best view in town!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant has great food, but it is very expensive (like everything else is in Lucerne!).
reviews.title: An outstanding hotel with great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is rated 4 star, but I can't imagine why anyone would want to pay even more for the '5 star' hotels right on the lake like the National or the Palace, though they looked gorgeous too.
reviews.title: Get the basic right! Appeareance is not enough alone.

reviews.text: Highly recommended!
reviews.title: One of the great hotels.

reviews.text: Our third trip and it lived up to the previous two. If there is one piece of advice it goes to those who stay half-board through a travel company. The hotel allocates you a table for the duration of your stay, usually away from the window. If you don't like it, be politely persistent and you'll almost certainly get a better table later in your holiday.
reviews.title: Just like being in a fairy tale. The views breathtaking and service impeccable

description: Appealing Art Deco-style Hotel located on a hill overlooking Lake Lucerne. The epitome of outstanding hotel management, individuality and joie de vivre. With fantastic views across Lake Lucerne towards the central Swiss Alps, the hotel is in a peaceful location, yet still only a few steps away from Lucerne's picturesque old town.
